repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Photographs of Merrimack Woolen Mills construction and completed mill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Merrimack Woolen Mills construction and completed mill.
Includes images of land clearing, excavation, and construction for new mill in Dracut, Massachusetts. Also includes an image of skinner engine installed in the mill in 1944.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Merrimack Woolen Mills Construction Photographs #6782 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: American Textile History Museum Collection, originally part of the Stevens Collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The ATHM # references the accession number given to collections by the American Textile History Museum (ATHM). These numbers have been kept and tracked for researchers looking for former citations. For images, these numbers will also be the digital object identifier if the item was scanned by the ATHM.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives 227 Ives Hall Tower Road Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheelref@cornell.edu https://catherwood.library.cornell.edu/kheel/

did.unittitle: Aerial view of Merrimack Woolen Mills, Dracut, MA, ATHM# 0000.1.41

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the Merrimack Woolen Mills complex in Dracut, Mass., in the center of the photo; houses visible in lower foreground and upper background. The body of water is Beaver Brook; the complex sits at the lower falls of Beaver Brook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the excavation work for the new mill on March 21, 1940. Excavating equipment in the background.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver print. Image depicts a wooden platform in an open area loaded with bags of sugar, apparently as a test for the foundation. Body of water (Beaver Brook?) seen in background.

did.unittitle: Excavation area cleared for new mill, ATHM# 0000.1.44

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the cleared excavation area for the new mill. Body of water (Beaver Brook?) is seen in background, with houses on the far side of the pond/brook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver print. Image depicts a view of the ongoing construction of the new mill. Foundation has been laid; framework is beginning. Construction workers visible in middle ground and background; construction vehicle in background. See item 6 in this folder for a view of the same area from a different angle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver print. Image depicts a view of the ongoing construction of the new mill. Foundation has been laid; framework is beginning. Construction workers and vehicles visible in middle ground and background; houses in background. See item 5 in this folder for a view of the same area from a different angle.

did.unittitle: Engineering sighting in construction area, ATHM# 0000.1.47

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver print. Image depicts a view of the ongoing construction of the new mill. A construction worker or engineer is taking a sighting in the middle of the foundation area. Construction workers visible at the top of the framework.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver print. Image depicts a view of the completed new building of the Merrimack Woolen Mills. Building is four-story multi-colored brick; reflected in pond in foreground. Written on reverse: "Merrimac Woolen Mill. Work started Thursday, February 29, 1940. Work finished November 1, 1940. R.S. Runnels, Lowell contractors."

did.unittitle: Skinner Steam Engine in Merrimack Woolen Mills, Dracut, MA, ATHM# 0000.1.115

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marion Photographers, Lowell, Mass. Gelatin silver prin. Image depicts a Skinner steam engine installed in the Merrimack Woolen Mills in Dracut, Mass. (owned by M.T. Stevens & Sons Co., Inc.)
